intro: Mapouria ancaranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar maple, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
